learning_outcomes.description: Understand the fundamentals of sustainable agricultural practices
Understand how intensification of agricultural practices can impact on rural landscapes and the wider environment.

Understand roles and priorities of stakeholders (farmers; conservationists; local, state and national governments; international and local NGOs) working at the interface of conservation and agriculture
Identify and develop a proposal to address a legitimate conservation problem

assessments.assessment_title: Written concept note and oral discussion
assessments.task_description:
Each student will write a concept note. The concept note will be evaluated and then each student will attend an individual 20-minute meeting with course academics to receive oral feedback on the written work. In the meeting students will respond to questions about the rationale for the concept note and will explain why their approach is appropriate for the problem that they have identified. The student and academics will also discuss how the project proposal should be further developed for the oral presentation.

This discussion will be scheduled 1 -3 days following your submission of the concept note.Times for meetings will be finalised well in advance.

Assessment and marking criteria (for the written concept note and the discussion) will be discussed in class and posted to Blackboard.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Concept note submitted through Turnitin on Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Oral presentation (accompanied by slides) of research proposal. Presentations will take place at previously agreed times (some will need to be outside of time-tabled periods) 18-22nd May in teaching week 12.

Students will be divided into groups and all students in a group will attend all presentations by other students in that group.

There will be a short Q&A after each presentation.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Online submission by Turnitin only by the due date and time. Refer to Blackboard for the submission link. No hard copy or assignment cover sheets are required. Submission via email is not accepted.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Reflection of course experiences and the development of the proposal from initial conception, through writing the concept note and developing the proposal through to the final oral presentation.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Online submission by Turnitin only by the due date and time. Refer to Blackboard for the submission link. No hard copy or assignment cover sheets are required. Submission via email is not accepted.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
The 2 hour exam will take place during the examination period.

This is an open book assessment and students will have access to course materials, their notes and other resources during the exam.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
